Dear all,

I have been successfully able to get most of Cantera's libraries=
 to compile under Visual 
Studio 2005. I have not attempted the Matlab, Pyt=
hon, or sundials projects since I am not 
using them. In order to get Cante=
ra to work under Visual Studio 2005 or Visual Studio 
2005 Express, you nee=
d to include these preprocessor directives to disable Microsoft's 
new secu=
rity features:

_SECURE_SCL=3D0
_SCL_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS
_CRT_SECURE_NO_DEPR=
ECATE

I have been able to build the most recent version of Cantera (with t=
he new directory 
structure). I created the Visual Studio 2005 projects fro=
m scratch by translating the 
Makefiles, so the base, kinetics, thermo, etc=
 are in separate libraries instead of in 
cantera.lib.

I would imagine tha=
t this will also work for Microsoft's newly released Visual Studio 2008 
ve=
rsion, but I have not verified it.

Regards,

Michael Lee
Software Engineer=

CFD Research Corporation


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Michael Lee" <=
melee.list@...> wrote:
>
> Dear all,
> 
> I am trying to build cantera's c+=
+ library with Visual Studio 2005 (importing the vc7 
> solution). I have r=
un into many problems with changes Microsoft has added to the STL 
> librar=
ies for bounds checking, iterator verification, and other "security enhance=
ments". I 
was 
> wondering if anyone else has gotten cantera to compile un=
der Visual Studio 2005, and, 
if so, 
> what tips can you give to help me b=
uild it?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> Michael
>
